meanings.definition: To crush or squeeze something with force.
meanings.sent1: She was squushing the playdough in her hands.
meanings.sent2: The chef was squushing the tomatoes to make sauce.
meanings.sent3: The elephant was squushing the tiny car in the circus!
meanings.sent4: The wrestler squushed his opponent with a powerful move.
meanings.sent5: The giant monster was squushing buildings in the city.

meanings.definition: The act of making a squishing sound.
meanings.sent1: The squushing of the mud under his boots was loud.
meanings.sent2: The squushing of the wet sponge echoed in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character's squushing noises always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The squushing of the tires on the gravel road was rhythmic.
meanings.sent5: The squushing of the grapes signaled the start of winemaking.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being squashed or compressed.
meanings.sent1: The squushing in the crowded elevator made her uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The squushing of the backpack against his back was heavy.
meanings.sent3: The squushing sensation of the tight hug made her giggle.
meanings.sent4: The squushing feeling of the tight jeans was unbearable.
meanings.sent5: The squushing pressure of the heavy box was overwhelming.
